page.title: 14LANDSCAPE SOUTH OF SALISBURY
page.content: Rolling downland and river valleys contrast with the suburbs of Harnham. The Avon here is liable to flood and areas of wetland wilst the Ebble, a small chalkstream only flows strongly in the winter. Although there is woodland on the Radnor estate & other small woodland areas exist elsewhere have been reduced to aid farming. In the northern third of the area new estates & infilling have extened the Harnham suburbs towards the watershed between the Avon & the Ebble. Small housing development have occured in the Ebble valley villages. Open countryside has been further reduced by the Odstock Hospital extension & the improvement of road junctions & carriageways.
